# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

None.

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width=10)
    lines = []
    words = split(text, ' ')æ®)

    for word in words
        if length(string(word))) > text_width
            push!(lines, "\n")
        end
        push!(lines, string(word)))
    end
    return join(lines, ' '))
end

# Example
text = "This is a very long sentence that needs to be wrapped according to the given text_width. Let's see how it works."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 15))
println(wrapped_text)
```
In this example, `wrap_string` function takes a string and a maximum text width as inputs. The function splits the input text into words and checks if each word exceeds the specified text width. If so, a new line is added. Finally, the wrapped lines are joined back to form the output string.
